p: South America is located in the Neotropical biogeographic domain and has an area of almost 18 million km 2 distributed among 12 countries. The continent has an extensive environmental heterogeneity, encompassing over 100 different ecoregions [ 28]. Among these are some of the most productive and megadiverse ecosystems on the planet, including forests (e.g., Amazon rainforest and Atlantic forest), savanna ecosystems (e.g., Cerrado, Beni, Gran-savanna), seasonally dry tropical forests (e.g., Caatinga, Chiquitano), and even deserts (e.g., Atacama).
